title: Ticket #2722: DAGMan should warn if a splice is marked as DONE
description: Right now, if you happen to have a splice marked as DONE in your DAG, DAGMan doesn't seem to complain about this at all.
remarks:
2011-Dec-16 12:57:25 by nwp:
This is a bit unclear to me. Does DAGman parse the DAG and then runs the nodes in the splice anyway, or does it carry on as if all the nodes in the splice are done? The latter behavior is what I would expect as a user.

2011-Dec-16 14:57:02 by wenger:
It seemed to just ignore the "DONE" and go ahead and run everything. Hmm -- looking at the code, it seems like if you don't specify a DIR on your splice, any trailing token is just ignored...

My first inclination is to say that we should just not allow a "DONE" on a splice, but maybe it would actually make sense to allow it (but that would be a lot more work).

2015-Apr-30 11:13:54 by wenger:
The same thing for NOOP -- if you append NOOP to the splice line it gets silently ignored.

I think both of these should be parse errors...
